bibl.title: Animal Husbandry in Ptolemaic Egypt.
bibl.note: Investigates the role of the Greek military settlers (cleruchs) in promoting stock-rearing alongside cereal production, and the relation it has with the progressive monetization and urbanization of Egypt.

bibl.title: The Economies of Hellenistic Societies, Third to First Centuries BC.

bibl.seg: THOMPSON Dorothy J., Animal Husbandry in Ptolemaic Egypt.
Zosia H. ARCHIBALD, John K. DAVIES and Vincent GABRIELSEN (Edd.), The Economies of Hellenistic Societies, Third to First Centuries BC (Oxford, 2011) pp. 390-401, 1 fig.

Investigates the role of the Greek military settlers (cleruchs) in promoting stock-rearing alongside cereal production, and the relation it has with the progressive monetization and urbanization of Egypt.
